column1: Otosclerosis is an abnormal bone growth in the middle ear that causes hearing loss.
People who have otosclerosis have an abnormal sponge-like bone growing in the middle ear.
Otosclerosis is the most common cause of middle ear hearing loss in young adults.
- Hearing loss (slow at first, but worsens over time) - Ringing in the ears (tinnitus) - Vertigo or dizziness
